website_summaries.verdict: Despite some minor color accuracy issues, the beautifully designed 34-inch curved Samsung CF791 monitor delivers top-notch gaming performance.

customer_reviews.title: Screen flicker when freesync enabled.
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful monitor, it really is. Colours are great and you get so much screen space you can have several things open at the same time with ease. There is a massive problem though when you enable freesync ultimate in the menu, most applications are fine but certain applications when in full screen make the screen flicker, so much so that I had to return this monitor. Also the stand felt loose without any means of tightening in as its a sealed unit meaning the screen wobbles from side to side. Gutted really as my search for a new monitor continues.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great apart from the stand is so poor, needs to be mounted by an arm!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome monitor to be quite honest but I cant give it five stars due to having to order a replacement due to the first having a dead pixel and now having to send the 2nd one back due to it tilting to the left by about 0.5cm. It's almost like the stand is loose but you cant get to it as its enclosed in the monitor. Bad build design but awesome monitor. After having this monitor for almost 8 months now I have now wall mounted it with a Ergotron Arm, This got rid of the tilt to the left and looks fantastic hovering above my desk! I can highly recommend this monitor
customer_reviews.author: Leighton

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic screen at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st curved screen monitor and it is a fantastic screen at a very reasonable price. The default settings are so good I have never bothered altering them, the Wide QHD display is excellent for movies in letterbox format. As I mainly play POE on it the latency does not worry me, if I was still playing Project Cars 2 then it might, that is why I only gave it 4 stars for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Rubbish for price
customer_reviews.text: Keeping it short haven't been this disappointed with a product i mean i was once robbed in london and wasn't this disappointed QUATOM DOT is an absolute load of rubbish pure marketing crap this monitor produce same image quality as my old Samsung monitor which was okay and didn't have Quantom Dot is nothing but false advertisement how they get away with it is beyond me i bought this purely for the ultrawide and quantum dot not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Dark_Moor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, lives up to the samsung hype
customer_reviews.text: Ignore the naysayers! I dont understand the bad reviews, this is great. Quantom dot means deep rich colours and more natural whites containing less blue light so this is better for your eyes. 100hz means smoother games whichi synchs much better with your graphics card, in my case an AMD Vega 56 and with freesynch turned on its great! I sent back an LG 34" IPS to get this instead which had light bleed... the viewing angles are a little better on an IPS but this ticks more boxes! Its the best 34" ultrawide.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Perrin

customer_reviews.title: This monitor looks great, but it comes with a huge BUT
customer_reviews.text: I have a Mac Pro 5.1 and this monitor looks great, but it comes with a huge BUT. From day one of installing this monitor It took me a good 2 weeks to set up as the monitors own "Colour Profile" in the Macs System Preferences looks awful and the monitor doesn't have a Mac driver, due to this fact its extremely hard to get the ideal deep rich colour and brightness setting which is a happy medium for Games - Movies and Work. Two weeks later I cant do better than 95% with the settings but I love this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... give it 5 stars because the display is just amazing. Fantastic well placed colours
customer_reviews.text: I give it 5 stars because the display is just amazing. Fantastic well placed colours, 100Hz really make a difference and it looks great. No backlight bleeding and the viewing angles are very good. Can't really see the difference when compared with an IPS. The only thing that could be done better would be the stand. It's sturdy but mine keep inclining a bit to the left. Have to adjust it once and a while... Great buy for the right price.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: issues with speakers
customer_reviews.text: so then the monitor is good, worth 700 dollars it is defiantly the best one ive ever seen in both picture quality and refresh rate. But the speakers are not very good , they make constant crackling sound i dont know if it was damaged during shipping or if the speakers are just bad.
customer_reviews.author: matilda

customer_reviews.title: Weird dim spot on two monitors that I bought.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this monitor it looks great, the issue is that on two of these monitors they have what I can only describe as a dim spot. On my first, it was a line near the top middle left of the screen. On my second there is a dot on the far left middle of the screen. It is really off putting once you know it is there. I'd return it and get a different monitor altogether if it wasn't for the fact that other similarly specced ones are £100+.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful ultrawide
customer_reviews.text: Really nice monitor with a variety of modes which can be applied including game mode for those sunny days you're struggling to see the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor, pushes gaming to the next level as ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent monitor, pushes gaming to the next level as the size, contrast and sheer quality make it a pleasure to use. The only downside is the stand as mentioned by others. Mine developed a small tilt to the left which cannot be remedied by the stand which is more style over substance. However this was not severe enough for me to return an otherwise defect free excellent monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Rafele

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for months, I really can't see myself buying anything but Samsung from now on as far as monitors go.
customer_reviews.author: D. Blakemore

customer_reviews.title: great picture using it as a gaming monitor on freesync ...
customer_reviews.text: great picture using it as a gaming monitor on freesync mode but the tilt reported by others from the arm out of the back of the monitor is an issue. I have wall mounted the monitor using the supplied vesa plate but had to fiddle around to keep the monitor level. EDIT returned it, power lead kept falling out and the tilt issue keeps happening, shame because the image quality was great. one other BIG problem, amazon no longer collect returns from home deliveries which is a real pain.
customer_reviews.author: steve harris

customer_reviews.title: Nice but ..
customer_reviews.text: Awesome monitor ... but I had to return two of them due to dead and stuck pixels, I guess I was just unlucky as my friend has the same monitor with no issues. I think I'll try a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Stephen J Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: Excellent monitor. Needed something that allowed me to work with 2 full sized windows for work and one big screen when playing games.
customer_reviews.author: TIM LACEY

customer_reviews.title: Great PC monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor! I would suggest putting it in game mode and doing a screen calibration for the best results. This way you'll see truer colours and no motion blur (e.g playing fifa). Great speakers as well. It's definitely a step up from the 790.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Superb if you have the room this monitor takes over your desktop.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! A totally immersive experience. Best monitor I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great Display For Really every Role!
customer_reviews.text: Magnificent screen image best connected with HDMI. Allows great productivity. I had up to 5 screens open. Thought it might be too large be but it is great. Sound good enough ... all it needs is a built in camera!m
customer_reviews.author: TEX1950

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Zero issues with my product, seems expensive but is honestly worth it, easily one of the best purchases I have ever made and if you compare it to other models with similar specs I would say it is reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely incredible monitor, and worth every penny. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely incredible monitor, and worth every penny. I currently use this predominantly for gaming, and the screen resolution is incredible as well as the sound quality!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic monitor! Great resolution Works well with my MacBook Pro 2012
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. J. Clegg

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture and colour quality, and the field of view in games is outstanding!
customer_reviews.author: Zax

customer_reviews.title: Video editing
customer_reviews.text: I use this to edit and it’s the best monitor I’ve used big enough to fit 2 decent sized windows on
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Andrew Stone

customer_reviews.title: Super wide screen.
customer_reviews.text: Great for gaming or watching tv in the office. Easy set up.
customer_reviews.author: Tiptoetony

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Really, really nice monitor. Takes up a lot of desk space but is worth every inch. Comes assembled so you really do just lift it out of the box and plug it in. The only minor, for me at least, drawback that's worth noting is that the VESA mount which is included doesn't allow for the monitor to be angled meaning that there's no way, as far as I can tell, to mount this in a corner - needs a flat wall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: also looked to be out of phase ( could see the red green blue down either side of the monitor) Pretty crap over all for the money you pay for ...
customer_reviews.text: Freesync flicker. Grey band across the top of the screen. Yellow tinge down both sides of the screen. also looked to be out of phase ( could see the red green blue down either side of the monitor) Pretty crap over all for the money you pay for this, after the problems i don't think this monitor is worth this type of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Viewing angles are bad. The curved ultrawide style is a gimmic and ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a massive shame the freesync doesnt work and flickers on nearly all refresh rates. The display port loses signal when launching games. Input lag is atrocious. Viewing angles are bad. The curved ultrawide style is a gimmic and might work better in a few years when we have better tech. Right now, if you dont have a 1080ti and a gsync there is nothing in this category 34" 1440p 21:9 100hz that works nicely for gaming. It is a real shame considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Evans

customer_reviews.title: The annoying thing about it is if you try to use ...
customer_reviews.text: The screen is big. the curve definitely takes getting used to and some may never get used to it. The annoying thing about it is if you try to use a 4k source on the hdmi port the monitor doesn't like it and says resolution not supported. Not sure if it was just my sources or not. The monitor obviously due to the ratio does not support true 4k but I would have thought it would scale it in some way instead of no support at all. Does mean having hdmi 2.0 ports means nothing as 1.4 would do 1080p fine anyway.
customer_reviews.author: P. Shek

customer_reviews.title: well its amazing! I paid just over £450 for it in ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow what can I say about this monitor? well its amazing! I paid just over £450 for it in the Amazon prime day deals however I would have been happy paying the full £700-£800 for this. Its totally worth it for any gamer or PC user. the colours and resolution are next gen. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: now i know what full immersion is all about!
customer_reviews.text: this monitor is the best i have ever had in 25 years of working with computers! the crystal clear images and colours are amazing. it sits well on my desk along side with my flat samsung and is truly wonderful to behold.
customer_reviews.author: alan harwood

customer_reviews.title: Good investment if you are looking for a large display
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for my work as a designer, pricey but well worth it! Usual exceptional Samsung high quality. After fine tuning the display settings to suit me personally, they are a joy to work with. Initial setup was like being on a sunbed! I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Cheap feel, and poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: I am definitely unimpressed. Cosmetically it is made of cheap plastic, and poorly made. To turn the unit on and off is a bit of a mission, what happened to a simple on/off switch? The graphical user interface is quite confusing too. If Samsung are going to demand a high end price tag, they need a high end product, and this definitely is not. I bought the Dell 34" Ultrasharp from Amazon instead and I'm struggling to fault it, well done Dell (On this occasion). Samsung, you have definitely tried to take a shortcut with this product, shame on you.
customer_reviews.author: Daran

customer_reviews.title: Loved it, but had to return.
customer_reviews.text: I really tried to get along with this for 3 days but it gave me bad headaches and eye strain. I think it may have been the resolution but not sure, I had to return it in the end and will probably go 2k normal aspect rather than ultra-wide. Real shame because it looked immense. I think part of the issue was I had a dual usage of normal office work and gaming. The gaming was OK but office work (which I did most of the day) was where it got painful.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rotheram

customer_reviews.title: Not as big as you'd expect
customer_reviews.text: Great but expensive. You could probably spend half the price for 99% the same product.
customer_reviews.author: Warrington Buckworthy

customer_reviews.title: Great for production, poor for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: Great for productivity not for gaming. Experiencing a lot of tearing when playing Overwatch as Lucio when I speed boost. I have an Nvidia GTX 1080Ti and I have to turn on V-sync and set the screen ratio down to 16:9 to prevent any tearing which is kinda pointless. I am a 3D modeller and render artist so it's great for production but for someone who also games it's a bit of a let down in that department. Games like DOOM and Fallout 4 look great where it's offline and you can move slower. For competitive gaming I wouldn't recommend it. Not until they release a G-sync version.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

product_meta.title: Samsung LC34F791WQUXEN 34" Curved Ultra Wide Monitor - UWQHD 3440 x 1440, 100Hz, Freesync, 2 x HDMI, Displayport, USB, Speakers
product_meta.description:
Style Name:W/O Thunderbolt 3 PortsWQHD 3440 x 1440 resolution - 2.5 times the pixel density of Full HD, Featuring Quantum Dot Technology. Built in speakers and 2 HDMI, DP, and 2 USB ports give you an immersive viewing space like no other

BOX CONTAINS
LC34F791WQUXEN Monitor
UK Power Cable
Quick Installation Guide
Installation CD
HDMI Cable
Displayport Cable
feature_bullets: Ultra WQHD enables a screen resolution of 3440x1440 — 2.5 times the pixel density of Full HD — that delivers razor-sharp images. The greater pixel density also creates a wider screen workspace
Quantum dot technology support approximately serge 125% for a wider range of more accurate colors — especially dark reds and greens — that stay crisp and clear even in bright light.
Dual 7-watt speakers embedded into the display let you enjoy movies, games, and online content without cluttering your desktop with auxiliary speakers or cables.
Samsung’s PBP lets you connect two input sources using HDMI and DP while maintaining the original image quality. Resize the second image to cover up to 25% of the screen and position it anywhere.
2 x HDMI, 1 x Displayport and 2 x USB 3.0 connections make this monitor the hub of your space

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars399 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
